titles: A visitation of love, peace, and good will from the spirit of the Lord sent unto the whole flock of God, now in this their day of tryal and hour of temptation, for the refreshing, strengthening, comforting and building of them up in their most precious holy faith, that they may be encouraged to hold fast the profession thereof through all tryals and sufferings, unto the end, that the crown immortal they may come to receive : being two epistles, the one from F.H. and the other from A.P.
author: Howgill, Francis, 1618-1669.
Parker, Alexander, 1628-1689. Salutation of dear and tender love.
notes: The first epistle signed: Francis Howgil.

"A salutation of dear and tender love, springing and arising from the fountain of light and life revealed from God, unto all the dear children of God, who love and believe in the true light" signed Alexander Parker: p. 9-15.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
